articles.title: U.S. war moves denounced in S. Korea
Rodong Sinmun on revolutionary principle of Korean people
U.S. Forces' pullback from South Korea called for
U.S. moves for war against DPRK assailed
Anti-war declaration released in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. moves for war against DPRK assailed 
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The research department of the Socialist Unionist Party and the center for the study of the Juche Idea of Syria in a joint statement on Feb. 7 urged the U.S. imperialists to stop blocking Korea's reunification, immediately pull their aggressor forces out of South Korea, halt their moves for a new war and respond to the DPRK-U.S. talks.
 The statement sternly denounced the U.S. for doggedly pursuing the war policy to stifle the DPRK by force, beefing up its aggression forces in the Korean Peninsula and its vicinity these days.    
 Noting that the U.S. policy toward the DPRK is a policy of aggression to stifle the DPRK based on justice dynamically advancing along the road of independence under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the great leader and peerless hero, the statement voiced firm solidarity with the friendly Korean people in their struggle to frustrate it.

articles.title: DPRK experts in handicraft give their first lecture in Mexico
KCNA ridicules western media's talk about DPRK's "brinkmanship tactics"
articles.content:
DPRK experts in handicraft give their first lecture in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK experts in handicraft held an opening ceremony of their lectures at a house of culture in San Nicolas city, Nuevo Leon state, Mexico on Jan. 30.
 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator (leader) of the National Executive Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, in a speech at the ceremony evinced his deep thanks to Kim Jong Il for sending the experts. He expressed belief that they would make a great contribution to the development of Mexican culture and the development of the friendly relations between the two peoples.    
 Owing to the U.S. machinations only Korea remains divided in the world, he said, adding: The Mexican people always extend support to the Korean people in their efforts for national reunification.

articles.content:
Reception given by Russian military attache
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Vladislav Prokopenko, military attache of the Russian embassy here, gave a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on Friday on the occasion of Russia's "Day of the Defenders of the Fatherland."
 Present on invitation were general Ryo Chun Sok and colonel general Ji Ki Son and generals and officers of the Korean People's Army and military attaches of foreign embassies here.    
 Russian ambassador Andrei Karlov and embassy officials were on hand.
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam leaves for Malaysia
Congratulatory message to Prime Minister of Antigua and Barbuda
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam leaves for Malaysia
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, left here today to participate in the 13th Non-Aligned Summit Meeting to be held in Malaysia.
 He was seen off at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-President of the Presidium of the SPA, Kim Yong Il, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and Wu Donghe, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of St. Lucia
articles.content:
Congratulatory message to Prime Minister of Antigua and Barbuda
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Hong Song Nam sent a congratulatory message to Lester Bryant Bird, Prime Minister of Antigua and Barbuda, on his 65th birthday.
 The message sincerely wished him fresh success in his responsible work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Guyanese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of St. Lucia
    Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, Premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Kenny Anthony, Prime Minister of St. Lucia, on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop, it wished the people of St. Lucia progress and prosperity.
